title: Monkeypox Timeline | Think Global Health
description: A frequently updated tracker of emerging developments from the beginning of the 2022 monkeypox outbreak
cleaned_text: The first human case of monkeypox—a rare zoonotic virus that can transmit from animals to people—was recorded in the Democratic Republic of Congo in 1970. Since then, the disease has become endemic in parts of West Africa, although outbreaks have been known to occur in other places, such as the United States in 2003 and now in over 60 non-endemic countries. This timeline was a running account, gathered in real-time, of key events in the 2022 outbreak as they unfolded from May 2022 to January 2023. As of January 20, this timeline is not being updated. You can access all of Think Global Health's monkeypox coverage [here](https://www.thinkglobalhealth.org/tag/monkeypox). Status as of January 20, 2022 - Total Cases Confirmed Globally: 84,916 - Total Deaths Confirmed Globally: 81 - Number of Countries with Confirmed Cases: 110 Ongoing Timeline of Events Follows Weeks of December 30 to January 12: Experts Worry Mpox Will Go Under-reported; One Dose of Jynneos Vaccine Can Minimize Mpox Severity, Hospitalizations January 10 - As mpox cases wane, experts [express concern](https://www.statnews.com/2023/01/10/health-officials-fear-mpox-infections-will-go-undetected-unreported/)that infections will go under-reported. December 30 - A Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) report [suggests](https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/71/wr/mm715152a2.htm?s_cid=mm715152a2_w#suggestedcitation)receiving one dose of the two-dose Jynneos vaccine for mpox can minimize illness severity and reduce hospitalization. The CDC still recommends receiving the full course of two-doses to optimize protection. Weeks of December 16 to December 29: WHO Says Mpox Outbreak Is Waning; U.S. Mpox Management Transitioning Out of White House December 27 - A report from Politico [suggests](https://www.politico.com/news/2022/12/27/white-house-mpox-00075606)management of the mpox outbreak will transition at least partially from the White House to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. December 21 - In its yearly health highlights, the World Health Organization [calls](https://www.who.int/news-room/spotlight/health-highlights-2022)the mpox outbreak "waning." Weeks of December 2 to December 15: FDA Approves New Mpox Kit; Biden Administration to Lift Mpox Health Emergency Soon December 14 - The U.S. Food and Drug Administration [issues](https://www.yahoo.com/now/fda-grants-emergency-authorization-thermo-211000199.html?guccounter=1&guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbS8&guce_referrer_sig=AQAAAACu35SSXpZKe9lAkLo-s0GpOX6XB5VbQymacrMCAeEo7G-taWd_Wu2YBE5cuiRyxw4VmBnzNMaYBZxw8Z8N8gwnjygHVHFrNkX99ZFdQXAf9PVRWPeO7fByBrhdrz_YokV3QfqhObhyb5QVBtDcFSuReFp39ht2PGrAW5uN6uTk)an emergency use authorization for an mpox detection kit made by Thermo Fisher Scientific. December 2 - Officials in the Biden administration [say](https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2022/12/02/monkeypox-health-emergency-lifted/)they plan to lift the monkeypox health emergency soon. Weeks of November 18 to December 1: African Continent Receives First Batch of Vaccines; WHO Recommends New Disease Name; Europe Secures More Vaccine Doses December 1 - The continent of Africa will [receive](https://www.foxnews.com/health/africa-receive-1st-vaccines-mpox-formerly-known-monkeypox)50,000 monkeypox vaccine doses as a donation from South Korea. This will be Africa's first batch of vaccines received since the public health emergency of international concern was announced in July 2022. November 28 - The World Health Organization (WHO) [recommends](https://www.who.int/news/item/28-11-2022-who-recommends-new-name-for-monkeypox-disease)a new name for monkeypox. Over the coming year, WHO will phase out "monkeypox" in favor of the preferred "mpox." November 18 - The European Commission's Health Emergency Preparedness and Response Authority [secures](https://www.biopharma-reporter.com/Article/2022/11/18/europe-locks-in-monkeypox-vaccine-supply-up-to-2024-with-bavarian-nordic-contract)an additional two million doses of the monkeypox vaccine from manufacturer Bavarian Nordic. Weeks of November 4 to November 17: New York City Phases Out Vaccine Vans; FDA Authorizes Monkeypox Test; Bavarian Nordic Sells Vaccine November 17 - New York City [phases](https://www.nytimes.com/2022/11/17/nyregion/monkeypox-vaccine-van-nyc.html?)out its monkeypox vaccine vans, which administered vaccinations outside nightclubs and sex parties. The local department of health will continue to offer vaccinations through sexual health clinics. November 15 - The U.S. Food and Drug Administration [issues](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/us-fda-authorizes-roches-monkeypox-test-2022-11-15/)an emergency authorization for a monkeypox test pioneered by Swiss company Roche. November 9 - Danish pharmaceutical company Bavarian Nordic reportedly [sells](https://www.ft.com/content/4b63d5ae-ab71-4db4-85ea-fb67ac633600)its monkeypox vaccine for between $70 and $300 per dose, pushing its revenues to all-time highs. Weeks of October 21 to November 3: Pre-Symptomatic Transmission May Be Possible; U.S. Death Toll Hits Ten; Ireland Purchases More Vaccine Doses November 2 - A BMJ [study](https://www.bmj.com/content/379/bmj-2022-073153)using data from the United Kingdom [shows](https://www.cnn.com/2022/11/02/health/monkeypox-spreads-before-symptoms/index.html)that monkeypox may be able to spread before symptoms become visible. October 26 - The U.S. death toll from monkeypox [hits](https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2022/10/26/monkeypox-deaths-hiv-black-men/)10. More than a quarter of global deaths from the ongoing monkeypox outbreak have been in the United States. October 25 - Ireland [announces](https://www.rte.ie/news/health/2022/1025/1331362-monkeypox-vaccines/)the purchase of another 15,000 monkeypox vaccine doses. Week of October 14 to October 20: Clade I Variant Spreading in Central Africa; China Starts Work on Monkeypox Vaccine; Mexico's Vaccine Shortage Pushes Citizens to Seek Vaccine Abroad October 20 - Reports [warn](https://www.nationalgeographic.co.uk/science-and-technology/2022/10/in-central-africa-a-deadly-monkeypox-variant-is-surging)that the Clade I monkeypox variant, which is ten times deadlier than the globally-circulating Clade II variant, is spreading in Nigeria and the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC). - China National Biotec Group, a vaccine manufacturer owned by the Chinese government, [starts](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-10-20/china-s-monkeypox-vaccine-will-target-the-actual-virus)work on a vaccine using a monkeypox virus sample isolated from the current outbreak. The vaccine being deployed now is a repurposed shot originally engineered to target smallpox. October 17 - Due to a domestic shortage, Mexican citizens are [traveling](https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/with-no-monkeypox-vaccine-home-frustrated-mexicans-go-abroad-2022-10-17/)abroad to seek the vaccine. Week of October 7 to October 13: Ireland to Open Vaccination Centers; United States and Democratic Republic of the Congo Collaborating on Clinical Trial October 12 - The Republic of Ireland [announces](https://www.rte.ie/news/health/2022/1011/1328622-monkeypox-vaccine/)plans to open eleven monkeypox vaccination centers across the country, aiming to vaccinate high priority groups by December. - The U.S. National Institutes of Health and the Democratic Republic of the Congo's National Institute for Biomedical Research [begin](https://www.nih.gov/news-events/news-releases/monkeypox-treatment-trial-begins-democratic-republic-congo)a clinical trial to test the efficacy of monkeypox therapeutic TPOXX. Week of September 30 to October 6: Spikes in Sudanese Refugee Camps; U.S. CDC Announces U.S. Outbreak is Slowing; U.S. HHS Expands Workforce Authorization for Vaccine October 5 - A new report from the Kaiser Family Foundations [shows](https://www.kff.org/racial-equity-and-health-policy/issue-brief/national-data-show-continuing-disparities-in-mpx-monkeypox-cases-and-vaccinations-among-black-and-hispanic-people/)monkeypox rates among Black people in the United States are over five times those of White people. October 4 - The United Nations High Commission for Refugees [reports](https://addisstandard.com/news-monkeypox-cases-in-sudan-refugee-camps-spike-to-120-unhcr/)a spike in monkeypox cases in Sudanese refugee camps. October 3 - The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services [expands](https://www.hhs.gov/about/news/2022/10/03/hhs-amends-prep-act-declaration-increasing-workforce-authorized-to-administer-monkeypox-vaccines.html)the workforce authorized to administer the monkeypox vaccine to include paramedics, dentists, nurses, midwives, veterinarians, and other healthcare workers. October 1 - The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) [reports](https://www.cnbc.com/2022/10/01/monkeypox-unlikely-to-be-eliminated-in-the-us-cdc-says.html)that the domestic outbreak is slowing, but monkeypox will likely continue to circulate at low levels in the United States. Week of September 23 to September 29: Early U.S. Data Suggests Vaccine Is Effective; WHO Releases Taxonomy to Target Monkeypox Misinformation; UK Announces Second-Dose Eligibility September 28 - Preliminary data [suggests](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/monkeypox-vaccine-effectiveness-cdc-precautions/)the Jynneos vaccine for monkeypox is effective in slowing infection, but U.S. health authorities advise at-risk individuals should continue taking precautions. - Pharmaceutical company Siga Tech [wins](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/siga-tech-receives-107-mln-order-antiviral-tpoxx-amid-monkeypox-outbreak-2022-09-29/)a contract bid from the U.S. Department of Defense for its anti-monkeypox therapeutic TPOXX. September 26 - The World Health Organization [releases](https://www.who.int/news/item/26-09-2022-who-releases-a-public-health-taxonomy-for-social-listening-on-monkeypox-conversations)a public health social listening taxonomy for monkeypox conversations in an effort to address misinformation surrounding the disease and its spread. September 23 - The United Kingdom Health Security Agency [announces](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/sep/23/monkeypox-vaccine-second-doses-available-for-most-at-risk-says-ukhsa)that at-risk individuals will be eligible for a second dose of the monkeypox vaccine. Week of September 16 to September 22: Canada Orders More Vaccines; Household Contacts May Contribute to Monkeypox Exposure; Officials Warn Against TPOXX Overprescription September 20 - Danish pharmaceutical company Bavarian Nordic has [expanded](https://medicalxpress.com/news/2022-09-danish-monkeypox-vaccine-maker-widens.html)its contract with Canada's public health agency to provide monkeypox vaccines. The new agreement will see a majority of the doses delivered in 2023. September 19 - Newly-identified pediatric cases [spotlight](https://www.cidrap.umn.edu/news-perspective/2022/09/florida-infant-new-hampshire-child-contract-monkeypox)the role of household contacts and surface contamination in monkeypox exposure and infection. September 16 - Health officials in the United States have [urged](https://www.usnews.com/news/health-news/articles/2022-09-16/fda-warns-against-overuse-of-tpoxx-monkeypox-drug)physicians against overprescribing therapeutic [TPOXX](https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/fda-approves-first-drug-indication-treatment-smallpox)in an effort to prevent viral mutations that counteract the drug's efficacy. Week of September 9 to September 15: Still No Vaccines for Africa; Community Vaccine Outreach in the United States; New Study on How Monkeypox Affects Brain Health September 14 - African health leaders [highlight](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/monkeypox-vaccine-shortage-africa-as-virus-eases-in-us-europe/)disparities in vaccine equity between Western countries and African ones, and worry interest in fighting monkeypox in Africa will evaporate as cases decline in the West. September 13 - United States [rolls out](https://www.politico.com/news/2022/09/13/monkeypox-vaccine-demand-outreach-hyperlocal-00056156)a more localized vaccination strategy to reach vulnerable populations in smaller venues. September 12 - Community health workers [push](https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2022/09/12/monkeypox-vaccine-black-gay-men/)to get monkeypox vaccines to Black men who have sex with men in North Carolina, where Black people make up 67 percent of monkeypox cases but only 27 percent of those vaccinated. - Physician Demetre Daskalakis [evaluates](https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2022/09/12/1122103937/the-top-white-house-monkeypox-doc-takes-stock-of-the-outbreak-and-whats-next)the U.S monkeypox outbreak one month into his job as deputy coordinator for the White House Monkeypox Response. September 9 - A new [study](https://www.thelancet.com/journals/eclinm/article/PIIS2589-5370(22)00374-1/fulltext)suggests monkeypox may cause [neurological damage](https://theconversation.com/monkeypox-may-cause-neurological-damage-including-inflammation-of-the-brain-new-study-190039), including brain inflammation. A small but noticeable proportion of people (two to three percent) with monkeypox who participated in the study became very unwell and developed serious neurological problems. Week of September 2 to September 8: Latin American Activists Call for Better Monkeypox Response; Cases Decline in Spain; First Cases in Hong Kong and Egypt September 8 - The WHO Regional Director for Africa, Matshidiso Moeti [reports](https://www.premiumtimesng.com/health/health-news/553290-monkeypox-nigeria-leads-as-africa-records-524-infections-12-deaths.html)524 confirmed cases and 12 deaths across 11 African countries. Nigeria is the leader in cases, followed by the Democratic Republic of Congo. - U.S. universities [use](https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-022-02855-w)lessons of COVID-19 to help prevent monkeypox spread on university campuses. - Egypt [reports](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/egypt-latest-in-mideast-to-detect-1st-case-of-monkeypox/2022/09/08/b92c4978-2f7b-11ed-bcc6-0874b26ae296_story.html)first case. September 7 - The Director of the Pan-American Health Organization (PAHO) [highlighted](https://www.paho.org/en/news/7-9-2022-americas-facing-covid-19-and-monkeypox-prevention-key-tackling-outbreaks-and)that over 30,000 cases have been reported in the region, making the Americas the global epicenter of the pandemic. Most cases are concentrated in the United States, Brazil, Peru and Canada, and primarily among men who have sex with men, although at least 145 cases have been reported in women and 54 among people under the age of 18. - PAHO [secures](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/paho-secures-100000-monkeypox-vaccine-doses-latin-america-caribbean-2022-09-07/)100,00 vaccine doses for Latin America and the Caribbean. September 6 - The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) [said](https://www.reuters.com/world/us/us-expand-monkeypox-vaccine-drug-distribution-through-amerisourcebergen-contract-2022-09-06/)it will significantly expand the number of distribution locations for monkeypox vaccines and Tpoxx treatment through a new $20 million contract with AmerisourceBergen Corp. More than 352,600 people in the United States have been [vaccinated](https://www.politico.com/news/2022/09/06/the-biden-administration-is-gambling-that-a-little-studied-vaccine-can-stop-monkeypox-00054742)against monkeypox with the JYNNEOS vaccine. - According to data from the [Centers for Disease Control and Prevention](https://www.cdc.gov/poxvirus/monkeypox/response/2022/demographics.html), people of color make up more than two-thirds of reported cases in the nation with 29 percent of cases reported among Hispanic people and 37.8 percent reported among Black people. However, only 22.1 percent of first doses of the JYNNEOS vaccine have been administered to Hispanic Americans and 10.4 percent have been given to Black Americans, [data from the CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/poxvirus/monkeypox/response/2022/vaccines_data.html)shows. - Hong Kong [reports](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/hong-kong-discovers-first-case-monkeypox-2022-09-06/)its first case of monkeypox. September 5 - Monkeypox infections [decline](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/monkeypox-infections-decline-hotbed-spain-health-minister-says-2022-09-05/)in Spain. September 2 - Monkeypox cases in the United States may be [declining](https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2022/08/26/1119659681/early-signs-suggest-monkeypox-may-be-slowing-in-the-u-s)due to vaccination campaigns and altered sexual practices, but experts urge caution. September 1 - Virologists [suggest](https://www.washingtonpost.com/science/2022/09/01/summer-viruses-covid-19-monkeypox-polio/)the increased prevalence of infectious diseases, including monkeypox, could be related to climate change because the changing environmental conditions make it easier for viruses to spread. - Latin American rights activists [call](https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/monkeypox-apathy-will-condemn-people-suffer-latin-american-activists-say-2022-09-01/)on their governments for a more robust monkeypox response, accusing them of underreporting cases. Latin American currently accounts for approximately 15 percent of confirmed cases worldwide. Week of August 26 to September 1: First Monkeypox Death in United States; Very Few in U.S Have Received Full Course of the Monkeypox Vaccine August 30 - United States [rolls out](https://www.nytimes.com/2022/08/30/us/politics/us-monkeypox-vaccines-equity.html)monkeypox vaccine equity program designed to make vaccines more accessible to low-income and minority communities. - First U.S. death from monkeypox [recorded](https://www.wsj.com/articles/texas-reports-first-death-of-a-person-diagnosed-with-monkeypox-11661880117?mod=Searchresults_pos2&page=1)in Texas. The patient was severely immunocompromised. - World Health Organization [states](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/monkeypox-outbreak-can-be-eliminated-europe-who-officials-2022-08-30/)monkeypox can be eliminated in Europe. August 29 - United States to [provide](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/us-govt-provide-11-mln-production-monkeypox-vaccine-2022-08-29/)$11 million in funding to support the packaging of the JYNNEOS monkeypox vaccine at Bavarian Nordic's U.S.-based manufacturing facility. August 26 - Daily totals of new monkeypox cases [decline](https://www.nytimes.com/2022/08/26/nyregion/monkeypox-cases-nyc-worldwide.html?searchResultPosition=6)in New York City from about 70 a day to 50. - Doctors [report](https://www.nytimes.com/2022/08/26/health/monkeypox-symptoms.html)seeing monkeypox patients with a variety of symptoms that are not typical of monkeypox and some that have no symptoms. - CDC Director Rochelle Walensky [reports](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/cdc-director-most-us-monkeypox-vaccine-shots-have-been-first-doses-2022-08-26/)that almost 97 percent of monkeypox doses administered in the United States have been first doses, meaning very few have receeved a full course of the vaccine. Week of August 19 to August 25: Vaccine Tourism in Europe; WHO Reports Decline in Global Cases; Bavarian Nordic to Boost Production August 25 - WHO [reports](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/who-reports-more-than-41000-cases-monkeypox-globally-2022-08-25/)21 percent decline in monkeypox cases globally. August 24 - Vaccine manufacturer Bavarian Nordic [vows](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/bavarian-nordic-vows-expand-monkeypox-vaccine-capacity-2022-08-24/)to boost vaccine production to make up for shortfall. - Switzerland [orders](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/switzerland-plans-procure-40000-doses-monkeypox-vaccine-2022-08-24/)400,000 monkeypox vaccines. August 23 - Mexico [reports](https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/mexico-cuba-report-rare-deaths-two-patients-with-monkeypox-2022-08-23/)the death of an HIV-positive man from monkeypox. - Cuba [reports](https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/cuba-confirms-first-monkeypox-case-visitor-italy-2022-08-21/https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/mexico-cuba-report-rare-deaths-two-patients-with-monkeypox-2022-08-23/)the death of a man from Italy who died of monkeypox. August 22 [United Kingdom](https://www.reuters.com/world/uk/britain-pilot-using-smaller-doses-monkeypox-vaccine-boost-supply-2022-08-22/)and [Spain](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/spain-approves-dose-sparing-monkeypox-vaccine-2022-08-22/)to pilot 'vaccine-dosing' strategy to conserve doses. August 20 - Indonesia [reports](https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/indonesia-brief-media-first-confirmed-monkeypox-case-2022-08-20/)first case of monkeypox in someone who traveled from abroad. August 19 - European Union [backs](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/eu-backs-changing-monkeypox-vaccine-injection-method-boost-supply-2022-08-19/)'vaccine dosing' strategy to conserve vaccines. Week of August 12 to August 18: WHO Solicits Suggestions for New Monkeypox Name from Public; Iran Reports First Case; Spain Asks European Medicines Agency to Approve 'Dose-Spreading' Vaccination Strategy August 18 - White House [announces](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2022/08/18/fact-sheet-white-house-announces-new-actions-to-combat-monkeypox-outbreak/)new actions to combat monkeypox outbreak, namely making more doses of the JYNNEOS vaccine and the antiviral treatment Tpoxx available and targeting measures toward areas with large LGBTQ+ populations. August 17 - European Union countries [see](https://www.nytimes.com/2022/08/17/world/europe/monkeypox-vaccine-inequality-europe.html?searchResultPosition=10)spike in vaccine tourism as inequitable distribution drives people to cross borders in pursuit of vaccination. August 16 - Countries around the world struggle to buy monkeypox vaccines in sufficient numbers due to [supply chain constraints](https://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2022/08/16/1117658734/the-who-wants-to-help-low-income-nations-combat-the-monkeypox-outbreak). These constraints are felt acutely in Africa, where so far no vaccines are available. - World Health Organization (WHO) [opens](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/who-vows-nothing-ridiculous-public-submits-ideas-rename-monkeypox-2022-08-16/)the process for renaming monkeypox to the public. - Iran [reports](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/iran-identifies-its-first-case-monkeypox-fars-2022-08-16/)first case of monkeypox. August 15 - France [reports](https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2022/08/15/monkeypox-human-dog-transmission/)first suspected case of human-to-dog transmission of monkeypox. - Cases [appear](https://www.politico.com/newsletters/weekly-new-york-health-care/2022/08/15/00051629%20(politico%20-%20permalink))to be slowing in New York, although they are still rising. - A new [study](https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(22)01436-2/fulltext#section-3d6acba1-acea-4be2-8dc9-b7e14e5b6583)conducted in Spain [suggests](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/aug/15/smallpox-vaccines-protect-monkeypox-hiv-erode)that smallpox vaccines may not provide life-long immunity from monkeypox. August 12 - Canada's chief public health officer [signals](https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/monkeypox-spread-may-be-slowing-canada-health-official-says-2022-08-12/)that the spread of monkeypox may be slowing but that public health authorities in Canada will remain vigilant. August 11 - Spain [asks](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/spain-asks-ema-allow-dose-sparing-monkeypox-vaccine-2022-08-11/)the European Medicines Agency (EMA) to approve the 'dose-spreading' strategy for administering monkeypox vaccines in an attempt to make vaccines available to more people. Week of August 5 to August 11: U.S. Approves New 'Dose-Spreading' Vaccine Strategy; Monkeys Attacked in Brazil; Spread Slows in UK August 10 - WHO [asks](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2022/08/10/who-monkeypox-monkeys-brazil-attacks/)people not to attack monkeys after several monkeys were poisoned or stoned in Brazil. Despite its name, monkeypox is spread through human-to-human transmission and not by monkeys. - The European Medicines Agency (EMA) [considers](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/europe-consider-dose-sparing-increase-monkeypox-vaccine-who-seeks-trials-2022-08-10/)'dose-spreading' strategy approved by the United States, but the WHO has called for more data and trials before such a strategy is used. August 9 - The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has [approved](https://www.politico.com/news/2022/08/09/fda-authorizes-new-monkeypox-vaccine-strategy-to-stretch-doses-as-outbreak-widens-00050708)a new way of administering monkeypox vaccines in which each person would receive a smaller dose in an effort to make a limited number of vaccines stretch to more people. The new method, which was authorized under an Emergency Use Authorization, has elicited [controversy](https://www.statnews.com/2022/08/09/will-low-dose-vaccination-stretch-the-monkeypox-vaccine-supply-or-backfire/)among experts. - United States [purchases](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/us-buy-sigas-iv-drug-worth-26-mln-fight-monkeypox-outbreak-2022-08-09/)$26 million worth of Sigma VI's intravenous monkeypox treatment Tpoxx. - Police in Washington, DC are [investigating](https://www.washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/2022/08/09/shaw-attack-monkeypox-slur-hate/)an assault on two gay men in which anti-gay slurs and references to monkeypox were used as a hate crime. August 8 - A California [wastewater surveillance system](https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2022/08/08/1115455190/covid-sewage-surveillance-labs-join-the-hunt-for-monkeypox)used to track COVID-19 outbreaks has been adapted to track monkeypox as well. - Italy [begins](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/italy-kicks-off-vaccination-campaign-against-monkeypox-2022-08-08/)its vaccination campaign against monkeypox. August 5 - A daycare worker in Illinois [tested positive](https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2022/08/05/monkeypox-illinois-daycare-center/)for monkeypox, causing a scare about the potential exposure of children to the virus. None of the children were infected, but all were given the JYNNEOS vaccine, which is available to men who have sex with men (MSM) and close contacts of those who have been infected. - The UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA) [says](https://www.reuters.com/world/uk/early-signs-monkeypox-outbreak-plateauing-uk-health-authority-says-2022-08-05/)there were "early signs" that the monkeypox outbreak is plateauing across the country and that its expansion has slowed. May 21 - WHO [records](https://www.who.int/emergencies/disease-outbreak-news/item/2022-DON385)92 laboratory-confirmed cases and 28 suspected cases from 12 countries in which monkeypox is not endemic for monkeypox virus in Australia, Belgium, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, the United Kingdom, and the United States since May 13. - Early epidemiology of initial cases notified to WHO by countries shows that cases have been mainly reported amongst men who have sex with men (MSM). - Switzerland [reports](https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/switzerland-confirms-its-first-case-monkeypox-2022-05-21/)first case. May 20 Week of May 12 to May 19: Monkeypox Cases Recorded in United Kingdom, Portugal, Italy, and Canada May 19 - Public health authorities in Canada begin [investigating](https://globalnews.ca/news/8848006/montreal-monkeypox-public-health-briefing/)17 suspected cases of monkeypox in Montreal. The first case in Canada is [believed](https://www.science.org/content/article/monkeypox-outbreak-questions-intensify-cases-soar)to have appeared on April 29 in a patient who had traveled from the United States. - First [draft genome sequence](https://virological.org/t/first-draft-genome-sequence-of-monkeypox-virus-associated-with-the-suspected-multi-country-outbreak-may-2022-confirmed-case-in-portugal/799)of Monkeypox virus associated with the suspected multicountry outbreak suggests the strain most closely resembles viruses carried by travelers from Nigeria to Singapore, Israel, and the United Kingdom in 2018 and 2019. - Italy [reports](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/italy-reports-first-case-monkeypox-infection-two-more-suspected-2022-05-19/)first confirmed case and two additional suspected cases. - Portugal [reports](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/portugal-spain-detect-new-cases-monkeypox-infection-2022-05-19/)14 cases and an additional 20 suspected cases after identifying them as the West African strain of monkeypox, which is less severe than the Congo strain. May 14 - The United Kingdom [reports](https://www.theguardian.com/science/2022/may/14/two-people-diagnosed-with-monkeypox-in-london-health-officials)two new cases of monkeypox that do not appear to be related to the first. Week of May 7 to May 11: Monkeypox First Identified in a Non-Endemic Country May 7 - A patient is [treated](https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2022/may/07/patient-treated-for-monkeypox-in-isolation-at-london-hospital)for monkeypox in the United Kingdom by a specialist after returning from travel in Nigeria.
